intro: Cousinia deserti var. deserti, commonly known as the desert cinquefoil, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with silver-gray foliage that reflects sunlight and reduces water loss. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers in dense clusters during the spring and early summer. It has adapted to harsh desert conditions through deep root systems and succulent leaves that store water. Cousinia deserti var. deserti is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
